intro: Croixia conferta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. Croixia conferta prefers well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or woodland habitats.
